metadata.title: CVE-2024-23635 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: AntiSamy is a library for performing fast, configurable cleansing of HTMLcoming from untrusted sources. Prior to 1.7.5, there is a potential for amutation XSS (mXSS) vulnerability in AntiSamy caused by flawed parsing ofthe HTML being sanitized. To be subject to this vulnerability the`preserveComments` directive must be enabled in your policy file. As aresult, certain crafty inputs can result in elements in comment tags beinginterpreted as executable when using AntiSamy's sanitized output. Patchedin AntiSamy 1.7.5 and later.

criterions.comment: libowasp-antisamy-java: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
